title: @Rito Why is Yasuo still not disabled?
body: Champions were disabled until fix for far less gamebreaking bugs - see Aurelion Sol. Is Yasuo getting special treatment again, or are videos of the bug all over youtube fake?

We disable champions if they're so bugged or overpowered that they need to be hotfixed. In this case while the bug does give Yasuo a significant amount of extra power, and fixing it was a major priority for the next patch, it didn't push his performance beyond what we consider the acceptable limit for a 2 week period. As a result we left him enabled.

Yes.

Acceptable till the next patch versus acceptable longer term are things we treat pretty differently. Statistically at least we'll generally be looking at hotfixes if a champs in the high fifities or above. That's not to say there isn't some real pain and problems sometimes with champions below that, hotfixes have risk associated with them (changes to servers while they're live, less testing time) though that mean it's only appropriate to use them pretty sparingly.

Thank you for your answer and I will try not to be too salty. The part with hotfixes bring risks is known. However we are not asking for hotfixes balance-wise, but rather hotfix the bug. And if this brings risk (another bug replacing the current one) or take more time and testing - why don't you just disable the champion while the process takes time? I mean at the end of the day the bug brings a lot of extra power to an already too powerful character. That's not a nice thing to deal with.

Most people haven't considered Yasuo to be "acceptable" since his release.

There's a reason that one of the first things people say when you talk about implementing 5 bans per team is that they are looking forward to never having to play against him ever again.

I honestly cannot wrap my head around why Yasuo is allowed to exist at the same time as he breaks almost all of Riot's stated design principles.

>I honestly cannot wrap my head around why Yasuo is allowed to exist at the same time as he breaks almost all of Riot's stated design principles.

Because he's CertainlyT's, who is allowed to break every single principal when designing, and Riot continues to hail him as a genius.  Then there's the added bonus that he's a flashy playmaker, so he's protected by Riot _twice._

Did I say he was the only one who makes overloaded champions?  No, I didn't, but way to jump to conclusions.  I'm talking about game design where the ideal healthy kit has already been explained through Zileas' list of design anti-patterns, and CT is somehow allowed to break every single one of them consistently and get away with it. What's worse, is that he's influenced other designers to do the same, and toxic bullshit is now running rampant through the game with hardly anything being done about it, it's only getting worse.

And for that list, Azir isn't that bad compared to some - he's just oppressive and non-interactive, Vlad shouldn't be on that list when Gnar exists, and as much as I dislike Nid, I can't believe I'm actually going to defend her - if you want to put her up there, where are Elise, Kled, and Jayce, the other form swappers?

You also forgot Kindred, Thresh. Kalista, and Fiora.
